text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the risk of losing rights due to material changes to the mark under the section 'Ongoing Risks and Responsibilities: How You Can Lose Your Rights,' specifically in point 4 ('Improper Use of the Mark'): 'If you registered a word mark in a specific form and then use a substantially different version, you may not be able to rely on your registration in enforcement actions, and you may fail to satisfy use requirements.'
